passages.1:1: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came<note: Literally "was"> to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, son of Iddo, saying,
passages.1:2: "Yahweh {was very angry with your ancestors}.<note: Literally "was angry against your ancestors [with] anger">
passages.1:3: You must say to them: 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts: "Return to me," {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts, "and I will return to you," says Yahweh of hosts.
passages.1:4: "Do not be like your ancestors,<note: Or "fathers"> to whom the former prophets proclaimed, saying, 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts: "Return from your evil ways and your evil deeds!" ' But they did not hear<note: Or "listen"> and they did not pay attention<note: Or "give heed"> to me," {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh.
passages.1:5: "Your ancestors,<note: Or "fathers"> where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?
passages.1:6: However, did not my words and my regulations which I commanded my servants the prophets overtake your ancestors?<note: Or "fathers"> And they repented and said, 'Yahweh of hosts planned to do with us according to our ways, and according to our deeds so he has dealt with us.'" '"
passages.1:7: On the twenty-fourth day of [the] eleventh month, the month of Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the prophet, son of Berekiah, son of Iddo, saying,
passages.1:8: {I had a vision in the night},<note: Literally "I saw the night," which means "I had a vision"> and look, a man riding on a red horse. And he [was] standing between the myrtle shrubs that [were] in the ravine, and behind him [were] red, reddish-brown, and white horses.
passages.1:9: And I asked, "What [are] these, my lord?" And the angel [who was] talking with me said, "I will show you what these are."
passages.1:10: And the man standing between the myrtle shrubs answered and said, "These [are] those whom Yahweh has sent to patrol<note: Or "to go about," or "to walk through"> [the] earth."
passages.1:11: And they answered the angel of Yahweh who was standing between the myrtle shrubs, and they said, "We have patrolled<note: Or "have gone about," or "have walked through"> the earth, and look, all the earth {is dwelling in peace}."<note: Literally "[is] dwelling and [is] at rest">
passages.1:12: The angel of Yahweh answered and said, "O Yahweh of hosts, {how long}<note: Literally "until when"> will you have no compassion on Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, [with] which you showed fury these seventy years?"<note: Hebrew "year">
passages.1:13: [With] gracious<note: Or "kind"; literally "good"> and comforting words Yahweh answered the angel who was talking with me.
passages.1:14: And the angel who was talking with me said to me, "Proclaim, saying, 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts: "{I am very jealous}<note: Literally "I am jealous [with] a great jealousy"> for Jerusalem and for Zion!
passages.1:15: And {I am extremely angry}<note: Literally "[With] a great anger I am angry"> with the nations that are at ease, for [while] I was a little angry, they {furthered disaster}."<note: Literally "helped disaster">
passages.1:16: Therefore, thus says Yahweh: "I have returned to Jerusalem with compassion. My temple<note: Or "house"> will be built in it," {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts, "and a measuring line will be stretched out over Jerusalem." '
passages.1:17: Proclaim again, saying, 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts: "My cities shall again overflow from prosperity, and Yahweh will comfort Zion again, and he will choose Jerusalem again." '"
passages.1:18: <note: Zechariah 1:18-2:17 in the English Bible is 2:1-13 in the Hebrew Bible> And I {looked up}<note: Literally "lifted up my eyes"> and I saw, and look, [there were] four horns!
passages.1:19: And I said to the angel [who was] talking with me, "What [are] these?" And he said to me, "These [are] the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem."
passages.1:20: Then Yahweh showed me four skilled craftsmen,
passages.1:21: and I asked, "What [are] these coming to do?" And he answered, saying, "These [are] the horns that scattered Judah, {so that no man}<note: Literally "according to the mouth of a man"> lifted up his head; but these have come to frighten them, to strike down the horns of the nations that lifted a horn against the land of Judah to scatter it."
passages.2:1: And I {looked up}<note: Literally "lifted up my eyes"> and I saw, and look, a man, and in his hand [was] a measuring rope!
passages.2:2: And I asked, "Where [are] you going?" And he answered me, "To measure Jerusalem to see what [is] its width and what [is] its length."
passages.2:3: And look, the angel who was talking to me [was] coming forward, and another angel [was] coming forward to meet him.
passages.2:4: And he said to him, "Run, say to that young man, 'Jerusalem shall be inhabited {like villages without walls}<note: Literally "[like] open regions"> because of the multitude of people and animals in its midst.
passages.2:5: And I will be for it a wall of fire all around,' {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of"> Yahweh, 'and I will be [the] glory in its midst.'"
passages.2:6: "Woe! Woe! Flee from [the] land of [the] north," {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of"> Yahweh, "for I have scattered you like [the] four winds of the heavens," {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of"> Yahweh.
passages.2:7: "Woe, Zion! Escape, you inhabitants of [the] daughter of Babylon!"
passages.2:8: For thus said Yahweh of hosts, after glory<note: The phrase "after glory" is difficult to interpret> he sent me against the nations plundering you: Truly, the one touching you [is] touching the apple<note: Hebrew "pupil," but the expression "apple of his eye" has become well-established in English> of his eye.
passages.2:9: "Yes, look! I [am] going to wave my hand against them, and they will become plunder for their servants, and you will know that Yahweh of hosts has sent me.
passages.2:10: Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion, for look, I [am] coming and I will dwell in your midst," {declares}<note: Literally "a declaration of"> Yahweh.
passages.2:11: "Many nations will join themselves to Yahweh on that day, and they will be my people, and I will dwell in your midst. And you will know that Yahweh of hosts has sent me to you.
passages.2:12: And Yahweh will inherit Judah [as] his portion {in the holy land},<note: Literally "upon [the] land of the holiness"> and he will again choose Jerusalem.
passages.2:13: Be silent, {all people},<note: Literally "all flesh"> before Yahweh, for he is roused from {his holy dwelling}."<note: Literally "the dwelling place of his holiness">
passages.3:1: And he showed me Joshua the high priest standing {before}<note: Literally "to the face of"> the angel of Yahweh; and Satan<note: Hebrew "the accuser," or "the adversary"> was standing on his right to accuse him.
passages.3:2: But Yahweh said to Satan,<note: Hebrew "the accuser," or "the adversary"> "Yahweh rebukes you, O Satan!<note: Hebrew "the accuser," or "the adversary"> Yahweh who has chosen Jerusalem rebukes you! [Is] this not a stick snatched from the fire?"
passages.3:3: And Joshua was clothed [in] filthy garments and was standing {before}<note: Literally "to the face of"> the angel.
passages.3:4: And he answered and said to the ones standing {before}<note: Literally "to the face of"> him, saying, "Remove the filthy garments from him." And he said to him, "See, I have taken away your guilt<note: The Hebrew term refers to guilt caused by sin (HALOT 800 s.v. 2)> from you, and will clothe you [with] rich garments."
passages.3:5: And I said, "Let them put a clean headband<note: Or "turban"> on his head." And they put a clean headband on his head, and they clothed him [with] garments. And the angel of Yahweh [was] standing [by].
passages.3:6: And the angel of Yahweh assured Joshua, saying,
passages.3:7: "Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'If you will walk in my ways, and if you will keep my requirements, then you will judge<note: Or "govern"> my house, and you will also guard my courtyards, and I will give to you passageways<note: Or "right of access"> among these that are standing here.
passages.3:8: Listen, please, O Joshua the high priest, you and your companions<note: Possibly his fellow priests> that are sitting {before}<note: Literally "to the face of"> you. For [the] men [are] a sign that,<note: Hebrew "for"> look, I [am] going to bring my servant [the] Branch.<note: Hebrew "Sprout" or "Shoot" ("Branch" is a traditional rendering in English)>
passages.3:9: For consider, the stone that {I set before}<note: Literally "I gave to the face of, "or "I gave in the presence of"> Joshua, on one stone [are] seven eyes.<note: Or "facets"> Look, {I am going to engrave an inscription on it},'<note: Literally "I [am] going to engrave its engraving"> {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts, 'and I will remove the guilt of that land in a single day.
passages.3:10: On that day,' {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts, 'you will invite {one another}<note: Literally "a man to his friend"> under [the] vine and under [the] fig tree.'"
passages.4:1: And the angel [who was] talking with me returned, and he wakened me as one who is wakened from his sleep.
passages.4:2: And he said to me, "What do you see?" And I said, "I see, and look, {a lampstand all of gold},<note: Literally "a lampstand of gold in its totality"> and a bowl [was] on its top, and its seven lamps on it, and seven lips on [each of] the lamps that [are] on its top.
passages.4:3: And [there are] two olive trees by it, one on the right of the bowl and the other on its left."
passages.4:4: And I answered and said to the angel [who was] talking to me, "What [are] these, my lord?"
passages.4:5: And the angel [who was] talking with me answered and said to me, "Do you not know what these [are]?" And I said, "No, my lord."
passages.4:6: And he answered and said to me, "This [is] the word of Yahweh to Zerubbabel, saying, 'Not by strength and not by power, but [only] by my Spirit,' says Yahweh of hosts.
passages.4:7: 'Who [are] you O great mountain? {Before}<note: Literally "To the face of"> Zerubbabel [you will become] level ground, and he will bring out the top stone amid the shouts of "Grace, grace to it!" '"
passages.4:8: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
passages.4:9: "The hands of Zerubbabel have founded this house, and his hands will finish it. And you will know that Yahweh of hosts has sent me to you.
passages.4:10: For whoever has despised the day of small [things] will rejoice and will see the {plumb line}<note: Literally "the tin stone"; this could refer to a plumb line or a plummet> in the hand of Zerubbabel." These seven [are] the eyes of Yahweh which [are] ranging {throughout the whole earth}.<note: Literally "in all the earth">
passages.4:11: And I answered and said to him, "What [are] these two olive trees on the right of the lampstand and on its left?"
passages.4:12: And I replied a second [time] and asked him, "What [are] these two twigs of olive trees<note: Or "two clusters of olive branches"; literally "two ears of grain," perhaps based on similarity of shape> on the right of the lampstand and on its left?"
passages.4:13: And he replied to me, "Do you not know what these [are]?" And I said, "No, my lord."
passages.4:14: And he said, "These [are] the two {anointed ones}<note: Literally "sons of the olive oil"> standing by the Lord of the whole earth."
passages.5:1: {I looked up again},<note: Literally "I did again, I lifted up my eyes"> and I saw, and look!--a flying scroll!
passages.5:2: And he asked me, "What [are] you seeing?" And I said, "I [am] seeing a flying scroll twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide."<note: That is, thirty feet by fifteen feet>
passages.5:3: And he said to me, "This [is] the curse going out over the surface of the whole earth. For everyone who steals has gone unpunished<note: Many translations render this verb as "will be cut off"> according to it, and [likewise] everyone who swears [falsely] has gone unpunished according to it.
passages.5:4: 'I have sent it out,' {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts, 'and it will go into the house of the thief and into the house of the one swearing {falsely by my name},<note: Literally "by my name to lie"> and it will spend the night in that<note: Hebrew "his"> house and will destroy it, with its timber and its stone.'"
passages.5:5: And the angel who was speaking to me went out, and he said to me, "{Please look up}!<note: Literally "Lift, please, your eyes!"> See what this [is] going out."
passages.5:6: And I asked, "What [is] it?" And he said, "This [is] a basket<note: Or "an ephah," a measure of grain> going out. And he said, "This [is] their iniquity<note: Hebrew "eye"; other ancient versions (LXX, Syriac) read "iniquity"> throughout all the earth.
passages.5:7: And look, the lead cover was lifted and a woman [was] sitting inside the basket.<note: Or "ephah," a measure of grain>
passages.5:8: And he said, "This [is] Wickedness!" And he thrust her [back down] into the basket,<note: Or "ephah," a measure of grain> and threw the lead cover on top of it.<note: That is, on top of the "basket" or "ephah">
passages.5:9: And I {looked up}<note: Literally "lifted up my eyes"> and saw, and look!--two women coming forward, and [the] wind [was] in their wings, and they had wings like those of a stork, and they lifted up the basket<note: Or "ephah," a measure of grain> between the earth and the sky.<note: Or "heaven">
passages.5:10: And I asked the angel who was talking to me, "Where [are] they taking the basket?"<note: Or "ephah," a measure of grain>
passages.5:11: And he said to me, "To build for it a house<note: Or "temple"> in the land of Shinar,<note: That is, Babylon (Gen 11:2)> and [when] it is put in place, it will be placed there on its site."
passages.6:1: {I looked up again},<note: Literally "I did again, I lifted up my eyes"> and I saw, and look!--four chariots coming out from between two mountains, and the mountains [were] mountains of bronze.
passages.6:2: With the first chariot [there were] red horses, and with the second chariot [there were] black horses.
passages.6:3: And with the third chariot [there were] white horses, and with the fourth chariot [there were] strong<note: Other ancient versions read "grey" here> dappled horses.
passages.6:4: And I answered and said to the angel [that was] talking to me, "What [are] these, my lord?"
passages.6:5: And the angel answered and said to me, "These [are] the four winds<note: Or "spirits" (The same Hebrew word can be translated "wind" or "spirit" depending on the context)> of the heavens going out after presenting themselves before the Lord of all the earth.
passages.6:6: {The one with}<note: Literally "Her with which"> the black horses [is] going out to [the] north country, and the white [horses] go after them,<note: Some interpret the word "after" to indicate a westward direction> while the dappled [ones] go to the south country."
passages.6:7: When the strong [horses] went out, they were anxious to go to patrol the earth. And he<note: That is, "Lord of all the earth"> said, "Go, patrol the earth." And they patrolled the earth.
passages.6:8: And he cried out to me and said to me, "See those going out to [the] north country have set my spirit at rest in the north country."
passages.6:9: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
passages.6:10: "Collect<note: The imperative "Collect" has no object; many translations supply "silver and gold" or "an offering"> from the exiles--from Heldai, Tobijah, and from Jedaiah, [all of] whom came from Babylon--and go on that day, go [to the] house of Josiah son of Zephaniah.
passages.6:11: Take [the] silver and gold and make a crown, and set [it] on the head of Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest.
passages.6:12: And say to him, 'Thus says Yahweh of hosts: "Look, [here is] a man whose name [is] Branch,<note: Hebrew "Sprout" or "Shoot" ("Branch" is a traditional rendering in English)> and from his place he will sprout, and he will build the temple of Yahweh.
passages.6:13: And he will build the temple of Yahweh, and he will bear majesty and will sit and rule on his throne. And he shall be a priest on his throne, and the counsel of peace will be between the two of them." '<note: That is, between king and priest>
passages.6:14: And the crown will be for Helem,<note: "Helem" is probably another name for Heldai (v. 10)> for Tobijah, for Jedaiah, and for Hen<note: "Hen" is frequently understood as a reference to Josiah (v. 10)> son of Zephaniah, as a memorial in the temple of Yahweh.
passages.6:15: And those who are far off will come and build the temple of Yahweh, and you will know that Yahweh of hosts has sent me to you. And it will happen if you will listen diligently to the voice of Yahweh your God."
passages.7:1: {And then},<note: Literally "and it happened"> in the fourth year of King Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah on [the] fourth [day] of the ninth month, [which is] Kislev.
passages.7:2: And [the people of] Bethel sent Sharezer and Regem-Melech, and their<note: Hebrew "his"> men, to entreat {the favor}<note: Literally "the face"> of Yahweh,
passages.7:3: saying to the {priests of the house of Yahweh of hosts}<note: Literally "priests who [are] for the house of Yahweh of hosts"> and to the prophets, "Should I mourn in the fifth month and keep myself separate<note: Or "abstain"; some interpret this as a reference to fasting> as I have done for these many years?"
passages.7:4: And the word of Yahweh of hosts came to me, saying,
passages.7:5: "Say to all the people of the land and to the priests: 'When you fasted and lamented in the fifth and seventh months for these seventy years, did you really fast for me?
passages.7:6: And when you eat and drink, are you not eating and drinking [for yourselves]?
passages.7:7: [Are] not [these] the words that Yahweh proclaimed {through}<note: Literally "by the hand of"> the former prophets, when Jerusalem and {its surrounding towns}<note: Literally "her towns around her"> were inhabited and at ease, and the Negev<note: The Negev is an arid region south of the Judean hills> and the Shephelah<note: The Shephelah is a geographical area on the western edge of the Judean hills> were inhabited?'"
passages.7:8: And the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah, saying,
passages.7:9: "Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'Judge [with] trustworthy justice, and show<note: Literally "do"> steadfast love and compassion {to one another}.<note: Literally "a man his brother">
passages.7:10: You must not oppress [the] widow, [the] orphan, [the] foreigner, and [the] needy. You must not devise evil in your heart {against one another}.'<note: Literally "a man his brother">
passages.7:11: But they refused to listen, and turned<note: Hebrew "gave"> a stubborn shoulder and {stopped their ears from listening}.<note: Literally "their ears were heavy from hearing">
passages.7:12: {They made their hearts adamant}<note: Literally "They set their hearts [like] hard stone"> in order not to hear the law<note: Hebrew torah> and the words that Yahweh of hosts had sent by his spirit through<note: Literally "by the hand of"> the former prophets; [therefore] great wrath came from Yahweh of hosts.
passages.7:13: 'Thus, just as I<note: Hebrew "he called" (but still referring to Yahweh)> called and they would not hear, so they will call and I will not hear,' says Yahweh of hosts.
passages.7:14: 'And I scattered them with a wind among all the nations that they had not known; the land was made desolate behind them-- no one crossing through [it] or returning--and they made the desirable land<note: Hebrew "land of desire," but this could be understood as a land characterized by desire rather than a desirable land> a desolation.'"
passages.8:1: And the word of Yahweh of hosts came, saying,
passages.8:2: "Thus says Yahweh of hosts: '{I am exceedingly jealous for Zion};<note: Literally "I am jealous for Zion [with] great jealousy"> I am jealous for it [with] great wrath.'
passages.8:3: Thus says Yahweh: 'I have returned to Zion, and I will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem; and Jerusalem will be called the faithful city,<note: Or "the city of truth"> and the mountain of Yahweh of hosts [will be called] the holy mountain.'
passages.8:4: Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'Old men and old women shall again sit in the public squares of Jerusalem, each with staff in hand<note: Hebrew "a man his staff in his hand"> {because of great age}.<note: Literally "because of the multitude of days">
passages.8:5: And the public squares of the city will be filled [with] boys and girls playing in its public squares.'
passages.8:6: Thus says Yahweh of hosts: '[Even] if it seems impossible<note: Or "wonderful"> {to the remnant}<note: Literally "in the eyes of the remnant"> of this people in those days, should it also seem impossible<note: Or "wonderful"> {to me}?'<note: Literally "in my eyes"> {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts.
passages.8:7: Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'Look! I [am] going to save my people from the land of the east, and from the land of the west,
passages.8:8: and I will bring them and they will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem. They will be my people and I will be their God in faithfulness<note: Or "truth"> and in righteousness.'
passages.8:9: "Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'Let your hands be strong, you<note: Hebrew "the [ones]"> who are hearing in these days these words from the mouth of the prophets who [were present] on [the] day {the foundation was laid for the rebuilding of the temple, the house of Yahweh of hosts}.<note: Literally "the temple, the house of Yahweh of hosts, was founded to be built">
passages.8:10: For before those days there was no wage for people or for animals, and there was no safety from the enemy for those who went out or those who came in, and I sent each person against {one another}.<note: Literally "his neighbor">
passages.8:11: But now {I will not deal with the remnant of this people as in the former days},'<note: Literally "not like the former days I [will be] to the remnant"> {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts.
passages.8:12: 'For [there will be] a sowing of peace; the vine will give its fruit, and the soil will give its produce, and the heavens will give their dew. And I will cause the remnant of this people to inherit all these [things].
passages.8:13: {And then},<note: Literally "and it will happen"> just as you were a curse among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel, so will I save you, and you will be a blessing. You must not be afraid; let your hands be strong!'"
passages.8:14: For thus says Yahweh of hosts: "Just as I planned to bring disaster<note: Hebrew "evil"> on you when your ancestors<note: Or "fathers"> provoked me to anger," says Yahweh of hosts, "and I did not regret [it],
passages.8:15: {so again I have planned}<note: Literally "So I did again, I planned"> in these days to do good to Jerusalem and the house of Judah. Do not be afraid!
passages.8:16: These [are] the things that you must do: speak truth, each [of you], with his neighbor; practice trustworthy judgment and peace in your gates.
passages.8:17: Do not devise evil in your hearts [against] your neighbor, and do not love {a false oath},<note: Literally "an oath of deception"> because all these [are] things I hate," {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh.
passages.8:18: And the word of Yahweh of hosts came to me, saying
passages.8:19: "Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'The fast of the fourth [month], the fifth [month], the seventh [month], and the tenth [month] will be for the house of Judah jubilation and joy and merry festivals; therefore love truth and peace.'
passages.8:20: Thus says Yahweh of hosts: '[It will happen] again that nations and the inhabitants of many cities will come.
passages.8:21: And the inhabitants of one city will go to another [city], saying, "Let us go immediately to entreat {the favor of}<note: Literally "the face of"> Yahweh, to seek Yahweh of hosts--I also will go!"
passages.8:22: And many peoples and powerful<note: Or "mighty"> nations will come to seek Yahweh of hosts in Jerusalem, and to entreat {the favor of}<note: Literally "the face of"> Yahweh.'
passages.8:23: Thus says Yahweh of hosts: 'In those days ten men from {all the nations of every language}<note: Literally "all the languages of the nations"> will take hold of the hem of a Judean man,<note: Many versions translate "a Jew," but "Judean" highlights Zechariah's focus on provincial geography> saying, "Let us go with you, for we have heard [that] God [is] with you!" '"
passages.9:1: An oracle. The word of Yahweh [is] against the land of Hadrach, and Damascus [is] its resting place. For to Yahweh belongs the eye of humankind,<note: "Eye of humankind" is difficult to understand in this context; some scholars emend the phrase to "cities of Aram" or "capital of Aram"> and all the tribes of Israel,
passages.9:2: and also Hamath, [which] borders on it; Tyre and Sidon--yes, they are very wise!<note: That is, wise in their own eyes (ironic)>
passages.9:3: Tyre has built a fortification for itself,<note: Hebrew "her"> and it heaped up silver like dust, and gold like [the] mud of [the] streets.
passages.9:4: Look! The Lord will drive it<note: Hebrew "her"> out and will hurl its<note: Hebrew "her"> outer ramparts into the sea, and it<note: Hebrew "she"> will be consumed by fire.
passages.9:5: Ashkelon will see and will be afraid, and Gaza will writhe exceedingly, and Ekron [also], because its hope is ruined.<note: Traditionally "ashamed"; some presuppose a different Hebrew form and translate "withered"> And the king from Gaza will perish, and Ashkelon will not be inhabited.
passages.9:6: A mongrel people<note: That is, a people of mixed marriage; "half-breeds"> will dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut down the pride of [the] Philistines.
passages.9:7: I will remove its<note: Hebrew "his"> blood from its<note: Hebrew "his"> mouth, and its<note: Hebrew "his"> abominations from between its<note: Hebrew "his"> teeth. And it<note: Hebrew "he"> too will be a remnant for our God; and it<note: Hebrew "he"> will be like a tribal chief<note: This word is sometimes interpreted as "clan"> in Judah, and Ekron [will be] like [the] Jebusite.
passages.9:8: But I will encamp at my temple<note: Or "house"> [like a] guard, against those crossing through and returning; no oppressor will cross through them again, for now I have seen with my [own] eyes.
passages.9:9: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem! Look! Your king comes to you; he [is] righteous and victorious, humble and riding on a donkey, and on a male donkey, {the foal of}<note: Literally "the son of "> a female donkey!
passages.9:10: And I will cut off [the] chariot from Ephraim, and [the] horse from Jerusalem; the battle bow will be cut down, and he will announce peace to the nations. His dominion [will be] from sea to sea, and from [the] River<note: That is, the Euphrates> to [the] ends of [the] earth.
passages.9:11: [As for] you also, because of the blood of your covenant, I will release your prisoners from {the waterless pit}.<note: Literally "[the] cistern there is not water in him">
passages.9:12: Return to [the] fortress, O prisoners of hope; today [I am] declaring [that] I will repay you double.
passages.9:13: For I have bent Judah [as] my bow; I have set Ephraim [as an arrow]. I will set in motion your sons, O Zion, against your sons, O Javan.<note: That is, Greece> I will wield you like the sword of a warrior.
passages.9:14: Then Yahweh will appear over them, and his arrow will go forth like lightning; and my Lord Yahweh will blow the trumpet, and he shall go out in the storm winds of [the] south.
passages.9:15: Yahweh of hosts will defend them, and they will devour and subdue the slingstones;<note: Perhaps metonymy for the slingers of stones> they will drink, they will make noise<note: LXX reads "they will drink blood like wine"> like wine, and they will be full like the sacrificial basin,<note: That is, the ceremonial bowl used by the priest for sprinkling blood> [drenched] like the corners of an altar.
passages.9:16: And Yahweh their God will save them on that day, as the flock of his people; for [they are like] the stones of a diadem, glittering on his land.
passages.9:17: For how [great is] his goodness, and how [great is] his beauty! Grain will make the young men thrive, and new wine [the] young women.
passages.10:1: Ask rain from Yahweh in the season of [the] spring rain-- Yahweh, who makes storm clouds, and he gives showers of rain to them, to everyone vegetation in the field.
passages.10:2: Because the household gods<note: Hebrew teraphim> speak deceit, and those who practice divination see a lie, and the dreamers of vanity speak in vain. Therefore [the people] wander like sheep;<note: Or "flocks"; the Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> they are afflicted because there is no shepherd.
passages.10:3: {My anger burns}<note: Literally "My nose becomes hot"> against the shepherds, and I will punish the leaders,<note: Or "male goats"> because Yahweh of hosts watches over his flock,<note: Or "herd"> the house of Judah; and he will make them like his majestic horse in war.
passages.10:4: From them<note: Hebrew "him" (or "it"), referring to the flock in v. 3> [the] cornerstone will go out, from them<note: Hebrew "him" (or "it"), referring to the flock in v. 3> [the] tent peg, from them<note: Hebrew "him" (or "it"), referring to the flock in v. 3> [the] battle bow, from them<note: Hebrew "him" (or "it"), referring to the flock in v. 3> every ruler, [all] together.
passages.10:5: And they will be like warriors, trampling in the mud of [the] streets in the battle. They will fight, because Yahweh [is] with them, and they will put to shame [the] riders on horses.
passages.10:6: And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and the house of Joseph I will save. And I will bring them back, because I have compassion on them, and they will be as if I had not rejected them, for I [am] Yahweh their God, and I will answer them.
passages.10:7: And [the people of] Ephraim will be like [a] warrior, and their heart will be glad as [with] wine. And their children will see and rejoice; their heart will shout in exultation in Yahweh.
passages.10:8: I will whistle to them and gather them, for I have redeemed them, and they will become numerous as they have been numerous [before].
passages.10:9: Though I sow<note: Or "scatter"> them among the nations, in the distant places they will remember me, and they will stay alive with their children, and they will return.
passages.10:10: And I will bring them back from the land of Egypt, and from Assyria I will gather them. To the land of Gilead and Lebanon I will bring them, until no [room] will be found for them [there].
passages.10:11: And he<note: LXX reads "they," referring to the Israelites (so NIV, NRSV, NASB)> will pass through the sea of distress, and he will strike the waves of the sea, and all [the] depths of the Nile will dry up. The pride of Assyria will be brought low, and the scepter of Egypt will depart.
passages.10:12: I will make them strong in Yahweh, and in his name they will walk, {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh.
passages.11:1: Open your doors, [O] Lebanon, so that fire will devour your cedars!
passages.11:2: Wail, O juniper,<note: Or "cypress"> for [the] cedar has fallen, for [the] magnificent [trees] are ruined! Wail, oaks of Bashan, for the impenetrable forest has come down!
passages.11:3: [Listen to] the wailing of the shepherds, for their splendor is ruined! [Listen to] the roar of [the] young lions, for the thickets of the Jordan are ruined!
passages.11:4: Thus says Yahweh my God: "Shepherd the flock<note: The Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> [doomed] to slaughter.
passages.11:5: The ones buying them kill them and go unpunished, and the ones selling them say, 'Blessed [be] Yahweh, for I have become rich.' Their own shepherds have no compassion for them.
passages.11:6: For I will no longer have compassion on the inhabitants of the land," {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh. "Look, I [am] going to cause humankind to fall, each into the hand of his neighbor, and into the hand of his king; and they will devastate the land, and I will not deliver [anyone] from their hand."
passages.11:7: And I shepherded the flock<note: The Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> [doomed] to slaughter, even<note: Hebrew "therefore"> the afflicted<note: LXX reads "merchants [of the flock]" which is reflected in some English translations> of the flock.<note: The Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> I took two staffs, one I called Kindness, and the other I called Unity, and I shepherded the flock.<note: The Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)>
passages.11:8: And I got rid of three shepherds in one month, for {I grew impatient}<note: Literally "my soul became short"> with them, and {they also became tired of me}.<note: Literally "also their soul detested me">
passages.11:9: So I said, "I will not shepherd you! The [one] dying will die, and the [one] to be destroyed will be destroyed. And the [ones] remaining, let them devour {the flesh of each other}."<note: Literally "each the flesh of her neighbor">
passages.11:10: And I took my staff Kindness and broke it, to break my covenant that I {had made}<note: Literally "had cut"> with all the peoples.
passages.11:11: And it was broken on that day. Then the afflicted<note: LXX reads "merchants (of the flock)" which is reflected in some English translations> of the flock,<note: The Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> the [ones who were] watching me, knew that it [was] the word of Yahweh.
passages.11:12: And I said to them, "If {it seems right to you},<note: Literally "[it is] good in your eyes"> give [me] my wages, but if not, {keep them}."<note: Literally "refrain"> And they weighed out my wages, thirty silver [shekels].
passages.11:13: And Yahweh said to me, "Throw it to the potter,"<note: Syriac reads "treasury," followed by NAB, NRSV, TEV> {this noble price}<note: Literally "the price of honor"> [at] which I was valued by them!" So I took the thirty silver [shekels] and I threw them to the potter<note: Syriac reads "treasury," followed by NAB, NRSV, TEV> [in] the house of Yahweh.
passages.11:14: Then I broke my second staff Unity to break the family ties between Judah and Israel.
passages.11:15: And Yahweh said to me, "Take again the implements<note: Hebrew "implement"> of a foolish shepherd.
passages.11:16: For look, I [am] raising up a shepherd in the land who will not attend to the [ones that are] perishing; he will not seek the young man,<note: Syriac and other ancient versions read "the wandering" or "the scattered," as do several English translations> he will not heal the [ones that are] crushed and he will not sustain the healthy [ones]; he will devour the flesh of the {fattened ones}<note: Literally "the stall-fed"> and tear apart [even] their hoofs.
passages.11:17: "Woe, my worthless shepherd who deserts the flock!<note: The Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> [May] a sword [fall] on his arm and on {his right eye}!<note: Literally "the eye of his right"> May his arm wither completely and {his right eye}<note: Literally "the eye of his right"> be utterly blinded!"
passages.12:1: An oracle. The word of Yahweh concerning Israel. "{Thus declares}<note: Literally "Declaration of"> Yahweh, who stretches out [the] heavens, founds [the] earth, and forms the spirit of humankind in its midst:<note: Or "forms the spirit of a man within him">
passages.12:2: 'Look, I [am] going to make Jerusalem a cup of reeling for all the surrounding nations; it will also be against Judah in the siege against Jerusalem.
passages.12:3: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day I will make Jerusalem a stone weight<note: Or "a heavy stone"> for all the peoples. All those lifting it up will grievously hurt themselves, and all the nations of the earth will assemble against it.
passages.12:4: On that day,' {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh, 'I will strike every horse with confusion, and the one riding it with madness; but over the house of Judah {I will keep my eyes open},<note: Literally "I will open my eyes," that is, "I will be responsive" or "I will pay attention"> and I will strike every horse of the peoples with blindness.
passages.12:5: And the clans of Judah will say {to themselves},<note: Literally "in their heart"> "The inhabitants of Jerusalem are a strength to us,<note: Hebrew "me"> through Yahweh of hosts, their God."
passages.12:6: " 'On that day I will make the clans of Judah like a pan of fire among [sticks of] wood, and like a torch of fire among stalks<note: Hebrew "stalk"> of grain, and they will devour to [the] right and to [the] left all the surrounding peoples, and Jerusalem will be inhabited again [in] its place, in Jerusalem.
passages.12:7: And Yahweh will save the tents of Judah first, so that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants<note: Hebrew "inhabitant"> of Jerusalem may not be exalted over Judah.
passages.12:8: On that day Yahweh will put a shield around the inhabitants<note: Hebrew "inhabitant"> of Jerusalem, and the one who stumbles among them on that day will be like David, and the house of David [will be] like God, like the angel of Yahweh, {before them}.<note: Literally "to the face of them">
passages.12:9: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day I will seek to destroy all the nations coming against Jerusalem.
passages.12:10: " 'I will pour on the house of David and on the inhabitants<note: Hebrew "inhabitant"> of Jerusalem a spirit of grace and supplication, and they will look to me whom they pierced, and they shall mourn over him, as one wails over an only child, and they will grieve bitterly over him as [one] grieves bitterly over a firstborn.
passages.12:11: On that day the wailing will be great in Jerusalem, like the wailing for Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.
passages.12:12: And the land shall mourn, {each clan by itself};<note: Literally "clans, clans alone"> the clan of the house of David by itself, and their wives by themselves; the clan of the house of Nathan by itself, and their wives by themselves;
passages.12:13: the clan of the house of Levi by itself, and their wives by themselves; the clan of the Shimeites by itself, and their wives by themselves;
passages.12:14: and all those clans remaining, {each clan by itself},<note: Literally "clans, clans alone"> and their wives by themselves.'"
passages.13:1: " 'On that day a well will be opened for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, {to cleanse them from sin and from impurity}.<note: Literally "for sin and for impurity">
passages.13:2: {And then},<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day,' {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts, 'I will cut off the names of the idols from the land, and they will no longer be remembered; and also the prophets and the spirit of uncleanness I will banish from the land.
passages.13:3: {And then},<note: Literally "And it will happen"> if anyone prophesies again, his father and his mother who bore him will say to him, "You shall not live, because you have spoken a lie in the name of Yahweh!" And his father and his mother who bore him will pierce him through when he prophesies.
passages.13:4: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day, each of the prophets will be ashamed because of his vision when he was prophesying, and they will not put on a cloak of hair in order to deceive,
passages.13:5: but he will say, "I [am] not a prophet; I am a tiller of the soil, for a man has acquired me since my youth."<note: Other translations read "for the land has been my possession since my youth">
passages.13:6: And someone<note: Hebrew "he"> shall say to him, "What [are] these wounds {between your arms}?"<note: Literally "between your hands"; that is, on the chest or on the back> and he will say, "Those I have received<note: Hebrew "have been struck"> [in] the house of [the ones who] love me." '"
passages.13:7: "O sword, awake against my shepherd, against [the] man [who is] my associate," {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh of hosts. "Strike the shepherd, so that the sheep<note: Or "flock"; the Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)> may be scattered, and I will turn my hand against the small [ones].
passages.13:8: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> in all the land," {declares}<note: Literally "declaration of"> Yahweh, "{two thirds}<note: Literally "a mouth of two"> will be cut off and perish, and one third will be left alive<note: Hebrew "left over"> in it.
passages.13:9: And I will bring the [remaining] third into the fire, and I will refine them like [one] refines silver, and I will test them like [one] tests gold. They<note: Hebrew "He"> will call my name, and I will answer them.<note: Hebrew "him"> I will say, 'They<note: Hebrew "He"> are my people,' and they<note: Hebrew "he"> will say, 'Yahweh [is] my God.'"
passages.14:1: Look! A day [is] coming for Yahweh, when your plunder will be divided in your midst.
passages.14:2: I will gather all the nations against Jerusalem to battle, and the city will be captured, and they will loot the houses, and the women will be raped; half of the city will go into exile, but the remainder of the people will not be cut off from the city.
passages.14:3: Then Yahweh will go forth and fight against those nations, like {when he fights}<note: Literally "the day of his fighting"> on a day of battle.
passages.14:4: On that day his feet will stand on {the Mount of Olives},<note: Literally "the mountain of the olive trees"> which faces Jerusalem on [the] east; and {the Mount of Olives}<note: Literally "the mountain of the olive trees"> will be split {in half},<note: Literally "from its half"> from east to west, [by] a very great valley; and half of the mountain will withdraw toward the north, and the other half toward the south.
passages.14:5: And you will flee [by] the valley of my mountains, because the valley of [the] mountains will reach to Azal, and you will flee like you fled from the earthquake in the days of King Uzziah of Judah. And Yahweh my God will come, [and] all [the] holy ones with him.<note: Hebrew "you"; LXX has "him">
passages.14:6: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day there will not be light,<note: Some suggest reading "flame" (= "heat") here> the precious things will congeal.<note: Or "the noble ones will congeal"; the Hebrew is difficult here>
passages.14:7: There shall be continuous day--it is known to Yahweh--not day and not night; and at evening time there will be light.
passages.14:8: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day, living waters will flow out from Jerusalem, half of them to the eastern sea,<note: That is, the Dead Sea> and the other half to the western sea;<note: That is, the Mediterranean Sea> it will happen [both] in the summer and in the winter.
passages.14:9: And Yahweh will be king over all the earth; on that day Yahweh will be one and his name one.
passages.14:10: All the land will be transformed into a desert plateau<note: Or "will be changed like the Arabah"> from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. But it<note: That is, Jerusalem> will rise up high and it will stay<note: Or "remain"> in its place from the Gate of Benjamin to the place of [the] former gate, up to the Corner Gate and from the Tower of Hananel to the king's winepresses.
passages.14:11: And they<note: That is, the people> will dwell in it, and {there will be no more ban imposed},<note: Literally "and there will not be a thing devoted to destruction" (that is, put under the ban of utter destruction)> and Jerusalem will dwell in security.
passages.14:12: And this will be the plague [with] which Yahweh will strike all the peoples that fight against Jerusalem: their<note: Hebrew "his"> flesh will rot while they<note: Hebrew "he"> [are] standing on their<note: Hebrew "his"> feet; their<note: Hebrew "his"> eyes will rot in their sockets, and their<note: Hebrew "his"> tongues<note: Hebrew "tongue"> will rot in their mouths.<note: Hebrew "mouth">
passages.14:13: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> on that day a great panic from Yahweh will fall<note: Hebrew "will be"> on them, and {they will seize one another's hand},<note: Literally "and a man will seize the hand of his neighbor"> and the hand of the one will be raised against the hand of {another}.<note: Literally "his neighbor">
passages.14:14: And Judah also will fight at<note: Or "against" (so NAB, CEV)> Jerusalem. And the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be collected--gold and silver, and garments {in great abundance}.<note: Literally "as far as the very multitude">
passages.14:15: {Like this plague}<note: Literally "And so"> will be the plague on the horse, the mule, the camel, and the donkey, and every kind of animal in those camps.
passages.14:16: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> every survivor from all those nations coming against Jerusalem will go up year after year<note: Or "from year to year"; or "yearly"> to worship [the] king, Yahweh of hosts, and celebrate the Feast of Booths.<note: That is, Succoth (or Tabernacles)>
passages.14:17: {And then}<note: Literally "And it will happen"> whoever of the clans of the earth does not go up to Jerusalem to worship the king, Yahweh of hosts, it will not rain on them.
passages.14:18: And if the clan of Egypt will not go up and come in, on them will be that plague Yahweh inflicts on the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Booths.
passages.14:19: This will be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Booths.
passages.14:20: On that day there will be [inscribed] on the bells of the horses, "Holy to Yahweh." And the cooking pots in the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh will be [holy] like the sacrificial basins<note: That is, the ceremonial bowls used by the priests for sprinkling blood> before the altar.
passages.14:21: And every cooking pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to Yahweh of hosts, and all those who sacrifice will come and will take from them, and will cook in them, and there will be no longer a {trader}<note: Literally "Canaanite" (Canaanites, especially Phoenicians, were merchants and traders)> in the house<note: Or "temple"> of Yahweh of hosts on that day.
